title: EROR Staged Sync   err="[8/15 HashState] hashstate: promotion backwards from 17240192 to 17239981"
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
2.43.0
OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
ubuntu 20
Erigon Command (with flags/config):
./build/bin/erigon --datadir=/erigon/etharchive --chain=mainnet --port=30303 --http.port=8545 --authrpc.jwtsecret=/jwt/node_beacon/jwt.hex --authrpc.port=8551  --authrpc.vhosts=* --torrent.port=42069 --private.api.addr=127.0.0.1:9090 --http --ws --http.api=eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool --http.corsdomain=* --http.addr=0.0.0.0 --http.vhosts=* --db.pagesize=16kb --snapshots=false

Hi, thanks for your great work,

My erigon node hangs because of memory, I restarted it, but it fell behind for a while, so I tried --unwind:
```
./build/bin/integration stage_headers --unwind=10 --chain=mainnet --datadir=/erigon/etharchive
./build/bin/integration stage_exec --unwind=10 --datadir=/erigon/etharchive --chain=mainnet
```

But after executing --unwind and restarting erigon again, it keeps reporting the following error, what should I do to restore it? Thanks.

```

[EROR] [05-12|01:34:32.837] Staged Sync                              err="[8/15 HashState] hashstate: promotion backwards from 17240192 to 17239981"

```

`so I tried --unwind` - you did unwind stages in wrong order. 
eth/stagedsync/default_stages.go:
```

var DefaultUnwindOrder = UnwindOrder{
	stages.Finish,
	stages.TxLookup,
	stages.LogIndex,
	stages.StorageHistoryIndex,
	stages.AccountHistoryIndex,
	stages.CallTraces,

	// Unwinding of IHashes needs to happen after unwinding HashState
	stages.HashState,
	stages.IntermediateHashes,

	stages.Translation,
	stages.Execution,
	stages.Senders,

	stages.Bodies,
	stages.BlockHashes,
	stages.Headers,
}
```

> make integration ./build/bin/integration print_stages

```
INFO[05-12|02:51:24.365] logging to file system                   log dir=/erigon/etharchive/logs file prefix=erigon log level=info json=false
INFO[05-12|02:51:27.564] [snapshots] Blocks Stat                  blocks=17150k indices=17150k alloc=2.4GB sys=2.5GB
Note: prune_at doesn't mean 'all data before were deleted' - it just mean stage.Prune function were run to this block. Because 1 stage may prune multiple data types to different prune distance.

> 



> `so I tried --unwind` - you did unwind stages in wrong order. eth/stagedsync/default_stages.go:
> 
> ```
> 
> var DefaultUnwindOrder = UnwindOrder{
> 	stages.Finish,
> 	stages.TxLookup,
> 	stages.LogIndex,
> 	stages.StorageHistoryIndex,
> 	stages.AccountHistoryIndex,
> 	stages.CallTraces,
> 
> 	// Unwinding of IHashes needs to happen after unwinding HashState
> 	stages.HashState,
> 	stages.IntermediateHashes,
> 
> 	stages.Translation,
> 	stages.Execution,
> 	stages.Senders,
> 
> 	stages.Bodies,
> 	stages.BlockHashes,
> 	stages.Headers,
> }
> ```

It may be that I did get the unbind order wrong, so what should I do now to restore it? Now stuck no longer syncing

> make integration ./build/bin/integration print_stages

Hi, Excuse me,

what should I do in this situation? Now I dare not operate at will, for fear of damaging existing data.

thanks for help.

In-theory Erigon must self-heal from such situation after restart. But it doesn't.

try 
- switch to branch `e2_hd_no_skip`
- make erigon
- start erigon as usually and show logs here
